segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on drying that plate, like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just cascading over the sink, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies, and that stool looks like it’s about to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share like this is normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman is while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window is so bright, but she’s completely in the dark about what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and she’s still just drying that same plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and no one is doing anything to stop him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so perfect, but inside, it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and she hasn’t even turned around once.
segments.speaker: PAR
